metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0159 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the GetStatistics64 remote procedure call (RPC) in OpenAFS 1.4.8 before 1.6.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted statsVersion argument.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent1 - 1.6.7-1
libafsrpc1 - 1.6.7-1
libkopenafs1 - 1.6.7-1
libpam-openafs-kaserver - 1.6.7-1
openafs-client - 1.6.7-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.7-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.7-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.7-1
openafs-kpasswd - 1.6.7-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.7-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.7-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.7-1').
